meanings.definition: Morose or sullen in mood or manner.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, Timmy was sulky and didn't want to talk to anyone.
meanings.sent2: She gave me a sulky look when I asked her to help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat looked sulky when it couldn't catch the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a sulky manner, ready to burst with rain.
meanings.sent5: His sulky expression made it clear he was in a bad mood.
